MEX vs. AIFA vs. TLC - Passenger Traffic (#mn of pax)

\(NPV =\) Reference value \(MT =\) Maximum Tariff \(TU =\) Traffic Unit (one passenger or 100kg of cargo) \(E =\) Investments \(^+\) costs and expenses (excl. D&A) \(TV =\) Terminal Value \(r =\) Discount rate \(n =\) Year
- Terminal Value (TV): begins in year 6 until the end of the concession (vs. year 16 previously). In addition, the growth rate is calculated using 10y CAGR of traffic units (vs. 5y previously).

- Discount rate (r): changed from Ke to WACC (risk free rate now has a clearer calculation, using 5y average of Mexican Bonds with maturity between 5 and 30 years). Besides that, the cost of capital is now calculated based on the whole group, instead of a cost of capital for each airport concession.

- "Claw-back" clause: adjustment in subsequent reference value in case actual traffic units exceed projected traffic units by more than 3%. In which case the economic value (TU \* MT - concession fee paid) of excess traffic units will be deducted from the next reference value.

Source: OAG, Morgan Stanley Research

Santos Brasil (STBP3.SA, Equal- weight, Price Target R\$13.00)
